author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Tuesday said he was a “little bit” surprised after President Trump, following his speech before the United Nations General Assembly, seemed to shift his support to Ukraine amid the ongoing conflict with Russia. “It was a surprise for me, you’re right,” Zelensky told host Bret Baier during a Tuesday appearance…
title: Zelensky ‘a little bit’ surprised by Trump shift

author: Max Rego
description: Late night comedian Jimmy Kimmel’s effort to clarify comments he made about the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk, which led to his show’s brief suspension, was seemingly “not good enough” for Turning Point USA. A spokesperson for the conservative organization, co-founded by Kirk in 2012, alleged his explanation barely scratched the surface. “Not good enough.…
title: Kimmel saying he never meant ‘to make light’ of Kirk’s murder ‘not good enough’: Turning Point spokesman

author: Joe Donnelly, opinion contributor
description: The SCORE Act is a proposed federal bill of rights for college athletes that would provide uniform NIL rights, protection from predatory agents, opportunities to share in athletic department revenues, increased degree completion and scholarship opportunities, and health care guarantees.
title: Student athletes win under Bipartisan SCORE Act

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: “Multiple injuries and fatalities” were reported in a shooting at a Dallas Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) facility, Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Kristi Noem said early Wednesday. “Details are still emerging but we can confirm there were multiple injuries and fatalities. The shooter is deceased by a self-inflicted gun shot wound,” Noem wrote…
title: ‘Multiple injuries and fatalities’ after shooting at Dallas ICE facility: Noem

author: Alexander Bolton
description: South Carolina Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) says he would like to see President Trump run for a third term in 2028, even though the 22nd Amendment limits the president of the United States to serving two terms. “Trump 2028. I hope this never ends,” Graham told Fox News host Sean Hannity late Tuesday. Graham made…
title: Graham says he would support third Trump term in 2028

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Late night comedian Jimmy Kimmel thanked conservative figures for defending him on Tuesday, after the ABC host returned to the TV following a temporary suspension. “Maybe most of all, I want to thank the people who don’t support my show and what I believe, but support my right to share those beliefs anyway,” Kimmel told…
title: Kimmel thanks Cruz, conservatives for defense: ‘It takes courage’

author: John Bolton, opinion contributor
description: Recent reports that the Trump administration is withholding roughly $400 million of military assistance to Taiwan are deeply disturbing.
title: Trump may be abandoning Taiwan to China’s tender mercies

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The president fired a Federal Trade Commission (FTC) member, without cause, despite protections enshrined in federal law — spurring a legal challenge that landed at the Supreme Court.   That was in the 1930s, when President Franklin D. Roosevelt fired FTC commissioner William Humphrey over policy disagreements tied to his New Deal.  Do you have déjà…
title: Trump’s independent agency bet at the Supreme Court

author: John Shkor, Steven Lepper and William Baumgartner, opinion contributors
description: We have no problem with lethality, but only when used lawfully and for the right missions.
title: Congress must investigate the blowing up of drug boats

author: Tara Suter
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Tuesday that a Russian incursion into NATO airspace is “unacceptable,” only a few days after multiple Russian fighter jets entered Estonian airspace. “Important call yesterday with my Estonian counterpart @HPevkur,” Hegseth said in a post on the social platform X. “The Russian incursion into Nato airspace is unacceptable. The Department…
title: Hegseth: Russian incursion into NATO airspace ‘unacceptable’
